CatDescriptText: Mrs. A. J. Graves, 1076 Rivermont Dr., Glen-Hazel Heights, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 16, 1957, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that parents should be imprisoned for the unlawful acts of their children (under 18 years of age)?" answer reads: "Yes, I think they should be. The reason is that if you're with y our children, you'll know everything about them and you'll know by their actions what they are doing.  It seems as though not very many parents know their children that well today, but they should.  That is the way my parents were and it was for the best."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. A. J. Graves wearing a patterned head scarf, eyeglasses, and coat, standing in front of grassy hillside
